Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Verushash is already in chips, but its not activated and is the old version. So its no longer CPU only.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I can easily finish that off and go to 1.1, which is the version labs fungible chains use. No GPU miner for it, bit can easily be made.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: FPGA I think could also, but as chips br is so small I don't see that happening.

Content: algo change won't fix the small reward problem

Author: phm87#7395
Content: but I agree that another algo can attract other miners

Content: It stops needing asic

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Sonits cheaper to mine

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: James always said it should revert to CPU mining as block reward gets smller

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But asic and stop chain dead if sha256 CPU mined chain.

Content: Right now, only CG is mining Chips I think

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Exactly. Verushash was half done, I know have the skills to finish it now, if that's something ppl still want.

Content: I added Chips on my pool in a hurry (while I was at work :abusedsmily: ) but it was necessary

Content: I hold quite a few chips so can do that, most of my chips are owned by a group of ppl who told me to invest in the bubble, chips was the safest thing to not lose 90% lol

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: I’m getting a miner on chips soon for shossain  as well

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Ideally if sha256 is to stay,  getting  merge mining going would help a lot

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Algo change is trivial, verushash 1 is there already, but not being used. I can use that as an example to change it to whatever.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If want to leave sha256 go for it. Less work for me.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: I’m not for or against any method at this point

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: With no block reward its pretty hard to fix, I think a 30s block time with some CPU alto would be OK, then some notaries can just mine if no miners are interested.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Merged mining solves the low reward problem however will require some coding and dedicated  pool operator to add chips, and then getting enough hashrate on the main coin to make it attractive .

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Could even make it so that payouts of auxpow coins is all done in chips.  Just swapping on Dex .  Kill a couple birds there

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Don't over complicate it, make it impossible for rogue miner to stall the chain and be done with it. Who cares if block reward is small. It has dpow for security, although slowing block time and reducing dpow to every 10 blocks is likely a good idea too.

Author: klein#5233
Content: time to crack out the power meter

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @klein i didn't rent hashpower, i put a z9m on it

Author: klein#5233
Content: 30 mins @ 300w?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @klein not sure what you are asking. z9m's are 300w at stock hashrate, overclocked they are more like 450w I think

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: batch 1 z9m's can be OC'ed by 50% (500 Mhz to 750 Mhz)

Author: klein#5233
Content: Ok

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @klein very roughly, a z9m will probably mine you about 20 LABS/day, with current hashrate. Obviously hashrate can change drastically at any moment, but that is a data point

Content: i did math on the back of a napkin, and there was actually no napkin 👼
